intro: Cyrtandra kalihii, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands, specifically found on the island of Kauai. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra kalihii is considered a rare and endemic species.
